metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6928 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: Drupal core 7.x versions before 7.57 when using Drupal's private file system, Drupal will check to make sure a user has access to a file before allowing the user to view or download it. This check fails under certain conditions in which one module is trying to grant access to the file and another is trying to deny it, leading to an access bypass vulnerability. This vulnerability is mitigated by the fact that it only occurs for unusual site configurations.

criterions.comment: drupal7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
